intro: Microstylis maculata, commonly known as the spotted microstylis, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Poaceae, commonly known as grasses. It is a small, herbaceous plant characterized by its delicate, grass-like appearance and distinctive spotted leaves. Native to parts of Asia, it thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodland floors and stream banks. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically arranged in dense clusters. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological studies and botanical gardens.
